intro: Acianthopsis sublesta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acianthopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in whorls along the stem. These flowers are often pink or purple in color and bloom during the warmer months. Acianthopsis sublesta is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
